text:
Hi there.
Layne Sadler from Boston.
• Recently wrote the AIQC framework (<http://aiqc.readthedocs.io|aiqc.readthedocs.io>) to drive adoption of deep learning in open science, and to make deep learning reproducible.
• Career product manager - most recently a biotech in genomics working on national biobanks w pharma.
• Ran the Jupyter 2021 survey.
• Love modeling nature as graph data structures.
Wondering if JuliaComputing is building out product management in Boston?

text: <@UGR3910CQ> thanks for lookin out. hows the prep for juliaCon coming along?

elements.text: thanks for lookin out. hows the prep for juliaCon coming along?

text: Shaping up to to be a great conference thanks to the hard work of all the committee folks!

elements.text: Shaping up to to be a great conference thanks to the hard work of all the committee folks!

text: We’re pretty distributed - hence not hiring by geography. At this point we do not have open positions, but we are likely to have as projects shape up. Let’s stay connected. Do see <https://pumas.ai/>

elements.text: We’re pretty distributed - hence not hiring by geography. At this point we do not have open positions, but we are likely to have as projects shape up. Let’s stay connected. Do see

text: Maybe we’ll see you at CAJUN meetups when they resume!

elements.text: Maybe we’ll see you at CAJUN meetups when they resume!

text: <@U67461GUB> Thanks for sharing - love a good meetup. Just joined the group.

elements.text: Thanks for sharing - love a good meetup. Just joined the group.

text: <@UGR3910CQ> <@U67461GUB> Would you guys be interested with help in running a survey for JuliaCon that focuses on user needs regarding Julia tools versus their Python tools with the aim of helping prioritize which tools to build? Performance over Python is a clear win, but ppl won’t truly switch until they have all the surrounding tools they need. We got some great data for decision making from the Jupyter survey: <https://github.com/jupyterlab/team-compass/issues/121#issuecomment-781634739>

elements.text: Would you guys be interested with help in running a survey for JuliaCon that focuses on user needs regarding Julia tools versus their Python tools with the aim of helping prioritize which tools to build? Performance over Python is a clear win, but ppl won’t truly switch until they have all the surrounding tools they need. We got some great data for decision making from the Jupyter survey:

text: That could be really interesting. I know Julia computing does a survey every year, maybe this could be part of it?

elements.text: That could be really interesting. I know Julia computing does a survey every year, maybe this could be part of it?
